resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
aucahuasi opened a new pull request, #14508:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14508

   Invoke `google::protobuf::ShutdownProtobufLibrary` to avoid memory issues detected by valgrind.
   
   Jira ticket:
   https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-18070

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #14508:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14508#issuecomment-1291227246

   https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-18070

pitrou commented on PR #14508:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14508#issuecomment-1291827771

   Why only in some tests?

lidavidm commented on PR #14508:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14508#issuecomment-1291928726

   From the docs, it sounds like we should find a way to just do this globally, for all tests? https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/reference/cpp/google.protobuf.message_lite#ShutdownProtobufLibrary.details

westonpace commented on PR #14508:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14508#issuecomment-1292178354

   I agree with @pitrou and @lidavidm .  We will want this on all tests that use protobuf.  Perhaps something like the way we setup and teardown S3 here: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/filesystem/s3fs_test.cc#L86

aucahuasi commented on PR #14508:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14508#issuecomment-1292700485

   Thank you all for the review, I sent some changes!

aucahuasi commented on PR #14508:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14508#issuecomment-1293628401

   > @aucahuasi Did you validate that it fixes the Valgrind issues?
   
   Yes, that was the first thing I did! 👍 
   Here is the output that I ran yesterday using the PR:

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14508#discussion_r1007264876


##########

##########

Review Comment:
   Do we even need a header for this?
   
   At least, this should be an `_internal` header so it's not installed



##########
cpp/src/arrow/engine/substrait/protobuf_test_util.cc:
##########
@@ -0,0 +1,32 @@
+// Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one

+// specific language governing permissions and limitations
+// under the License.
+
+#include "arrow/engine/substrait/protobuf_test_util.h"
+
+#include <google/protobuf/stubs/common.h>

Review Comment:
   in the docs, it seems ShutdownProtobufLibrary comes from message_lite.h; stubs/common.h isn't in the API documentation and I'm not sure we should depend on an internal-looking header

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
See https://dev.azure.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/_build/results?buildId=37514&view=logs&j=0da5d1d9-276d-5173-c4c4-9d4d4ed14fdb&t=d9b15392-e4ce-5e4c-0c8c-b69645229181&l=5635 for an example.

It's unclear to me at the moment if these are valid leaks or something we need to suppress.

It's also possible they could be prevented by running {{google::protobuf::ShutdownProtobufLibrary()}} at test shutdown.

Either way, it would be good to validate these are not legitimate issues and prevent them in some way.
fields.summary: [C++] Valgrind reports leaks from protobuf allocated memory in substrait tests
